label: Hero
description: A large, eye-catching banner usually containing an image, headline, and call-to-action.

label: Header
description: Top section of the email that often includes a logo, navigation, and preheader text.

label: Footer
description: Bottom section with contact information, social links, and unsubscribe options.

label: Contact
description: A block with address, phone number, email, and other ways to contact the business.

label: CTA
description: A clear call-to-action button or link prompting the user to take an action.

label: Image
description: A standalone image block used for visual storytelling or product display.

label: Text
description: A simple text block used for paragraphs, announcements, or introductions.

label: Image text
description: A combination block featuring an image next to text content.

label: Text image
description: Text content followed by an image, often used for articles or product showcases.

label: Button
description: A reusable button block for secondary CTAs.

label: Divider
description: A horizontal line used to visually separate sections of the email.

label: Spacer
description: A blank block used to add spacing between sections.

label: Social
description: Icons linking to various social media platforms.

label: Testimonial
description: A block that displays customer quotes or reviews.

label: Product
description: A block showcasing a single product with image, title, price, and button.

label: Products grid
description: A multi-column layout featuring several products.

label: Newsletter
description: A section promoting email signups or subscription-based content.

label: Event
description: A block promoting an event, with date, time, and registration button.

label: Countdown
description: A timer element used to create urgency around offers or events.

label: Video
description: A thumbnail or embedded block linking to a video (hosted externally).

label: FAQ
description: A list of frequently asked questions and answers.

label: Logo
description: A block used to place the brandâ€™s logo, typically in the header or footer.

label: Menu
description: A horizontal or vertical navigation menu linking to different sections or pages.

label: Signature
description: A personal sign-off section often used in newsletters or personalized messages.
